jsongminer
Class EchoNestMiner

java.lang.Object
  jsongminer.EchoNestMiner

public class EchoNestMiner
extends java.lang.Object

Objects of this class are used to identify songs and extract information about them from the Echo Nest API. This class inculdes methods for identifying unknown audio files using the Echo Nest's fingerprinting codegen binary and/or the Echo Nest's remote fingerprinting service. There is also a method for identifying audio files using known metadata (e.g. data extracted from ID3 fields). Methods are also included for extracting additional kinds of information from the Echo Nest API.

Calling the getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDUsingBestAvailableMethod method is generally the best approach to use for identifying an unknown song. Once this is done, other methods can be called to extract additional information about the song, such as getAndStoreSongMetaData and getAndStoreArtistMetaData. Better yet, the getAllAvailableNewMetaData method can be called to get all appropriate and available metadata once the Echo Nest Song ID has been acquired for a song.

Each object of this class maintains a private music_meta_data field that holds a vector of MusicMetaData objects. Each method call to an EchoNestMiner object gives the user the option of having the data extracted by the given method be stored in this vector. If this is done, then all of the extracted data to date can be accessed from this vector at a later time. Information for multiple songs could be stored in this way, but in practice it is best to store only information for a single song in each EchoNestMiner object. Echo Nest song IDs are used as unique identifiers in objects of this class.

Local fingerprinting is done using the Echo Nest codegen binary, which may be downloaded (with permission) from http://groups.google.com/group/enmfp. Metadata extraction is done using the Echo Nest web services API, which is outlined http://developer.echonest.com/docs/v4/. The jEN-api library, available http://code.google.com/p/jen-api/, is used to send requests and interperet returned results from the Echo Nest API. Also, the JSON.simple library, described at http://code.google.com/p/json-simple/, is used to parse JSON-formatted data.

getExtractedMetadata

public MusicMetaData[] getExtractedMetadata()
Return an array holding all of the metadata that has been extracted and stored internally by this object so far.

Returns:
The extracted metadata so far. Null if none is available.

getAndStoreFullFingerpintingCodegenOutput

public java.lang.String getAndStoreFullFingerpintingCodegenOutput(java.lang.String music_file_path,
                                                                  boolean store_result,
                                                                  java.lang.String run_script_path,
                                                                  java.lang.String en_codegen_directory)
                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Extract and return the full JSON dictionary output by the the Echo Nest fingerprinting codegen for the specified file. This dictionary is also stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field if the store_result parameter is true. Default values are used for the audio offset and duration to process.

Parameters:
music_file_path - The path of the audio file to find a fingerprint for.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the JSON dictionary generated to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
run_script_path - The path of the Echo Nest codegen binary, or a script to run it. e.g. "./ENFP_Codegen.sh"
en_codegen_directory - The path of the directory holding the Echo Nest codegen fingerprinting binary. e.g. "/home/ENMF/"
Returns:
The JSON dictionary output by the the Echo Nest fingerprinting codegen. This includes both metadata extracted from annotations embedded in the file, as well as the fingerprint resulting from audio analysis itself. Null is returned if no results were generated.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if a problem occurs.

getAndStoreFullFingerpintingCodegenOutput

public java.lang.String getAndStoreFullFingerpintingCodegenOutput(java.lang.String music_file_path,
                                                                  java.lang.String offset_from_beginning,
                                                                  java.lang.String duration_of_audio,
                                                                  boolean store_result,
                                                                  java.lang.String run_script_path,
                                                                  java.lang.String en_codegen_directory)
                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Extract and return the full JSON dictionary output by the the Echo Nest fingerprinting codegen for the specified file. This dictionary is also stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field if the store_result parameter is true.

Parameters:
music_file_path - The path of the audio file to find a fingerprint for.
offset_from_beginning - The offset in seconds from the beginning of the file indicating where to begin fingerprinting. e.g. "10"
duration_of_audio - The duration of audio to process after the offset_from_beginning. e.g. "50"
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the JSON dictionary generated to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
run_script_path - The path of the Echo Nest codegen binary, or a script to run it. e.g. "./ENFP_Codegen.sh"
en_codegen_directory - The path of the directory holding the Echo Nest codegen fingerprinting binary. e.g. "/home/ENMF/"
Returns:
The JSON dictionary output by the the Echo Nest fingerprinting codegen. This includes both metadata extracted from annotations embedded in the file, as well as the fingerprint resulting from audio analysis itself. Null is returned if no results were generated.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if a problem occurs.

getAndStoreENMFHash

public java.lang.String getAndStoreENMFHash(java.lang.String codegen_json_output,
                                            boolean store_result)
Given the JSON dictionary output of the Echo Nest fingerprinting codegen, this method extracts and returns the ENMF fingerprint hash from it. This hash is also stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field if the store_result parameter is true.

Parameters:
codegen_json_output - The JSON dictionary that is output by the Echo Nest fingerprinting codegen.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the ENMF hash extracted by this method to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
Returns:
The ENMF fingerprint hash contained in the given JSON dictionary. Null if it cannot be extracted.

getAndStoreFullSongIdentifyResponse

public java.lang.String getAndStoreFullSongIdentifyResponse(java.lang.String enmf_hash,
                                                            boolean store_result)
Use the provided ENMF fingerprint hash to identify a song. The full JSON dictionary response to a Echo Nest Song Identify query is returned. It is also stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field if the store_result parameter is true.

Parameters:
enmf_hash - An ENMF fingerprint hash that is embedded in the JSON dictionary produced by processin a piece of audio with the Echo Nest fingerprinting codegen.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the response to the query sumbitted by this method to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
Returns:
The full JSON dictionrary response by the Echo Nest API to the Song Identify query. Null is returned if a problem occurs (however, null is NOT, returned if the Echo Nest simply does not get a match, as this results in a JSON response).

getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromFingerPrint

public java.lang.String getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromFingerPrint(java.lang.String song_identify_json_output,
                                                                 boolean store_result)
Given the JSON dictionary output of the Echo Nest Song Idenify API, this method extracts and returns the Echo Nest Song ID code from it. This ID is also stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field if the store_result parameter is true.

Parameters:
song_identify_json_output - The JSON dictionary that is output by the Echo Nest Song Identify API.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the Song ID extracted by this method to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
Returns:
The Echo Nest Song ID contained in the given JSON dictionary. Null if it cannot be extracted.

getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromLocalFingerPrint

public java.lang.String getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromLocalFingerPrint(java.lang.String music_file_path,
                                                                      boolean store_results,
                                                                      java.lang.String run_script_path,
                                                                      java.lang.String en_codegen_directory)
Given the path to an audio file, extract its ENMF fingerprint hash using the locally accessible Echo Nest's binary codegen, and then use the Echo Nest API to extract the Echo Nest Song ID for the specified audio using this fingerprint hash. Depending on the vaule of the store_results field, the fingerprint hash and the Song ID may be stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field.

Parameters:
music_file_path - The path of the audio file to identify.
store_results - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the ENMF hash and the Echo Nest Song ID to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction). Note that there are other types of intermediate data that can be stored, but are not regardless of the value of this parameter, namely the raw JSON strings used by the Echo Nest. If one wishes to store these, they may be extracted using other methods of this class.
run_script_path - The path of the Echo Nest codegen binary, or a script to run it. e.g. "./ENFP_Codegen.sh"
en_codegen_directory - The path of the directory holding the Echo Nest codegen fingerprinting binary. e.g. "/home/ENMF/"
Returns:
The Echo Nest Song ID of the specified audio file. Null if it cannot be extracted.

getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromRemoteFingerPrint

public java.lang.String getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromRemoteFingerPrint(java.lang.String music_file_path,
                                                                       boolean store_result)
Given the path to an audio file, upload this file to the Echo Nest and have it dentify the song remotely using fingerprinting. The song title and artist name are extracted from this, and the Echo Nest Song ID is then extracted based on these two metadata fields. Depending on the vaule of the store_result field, the Song ID may be stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field.

Note that since it is only possible to base the Song ID on the song title and artist name metadata (even though the Echo Nest Track from which they are derived does not itself have this limitation) there may be confusion as to the particular version of the song if there are multiple recordings available for the same artist.

This method is thus less reliable than the getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromLocalFingerPrint method, but more reliable than the getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromMetadata method, since the latter makes use of potentially very noisy embedded metadata.

Parameters:
music_file_path - The path of the audio file to identify.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the Echo Nest Song ID to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
Returns:
The Echo Nest Song ID of the specified audio file. Null if it cannot be extracted.

getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromMetadata

public java.lang.String getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDFromMetadata(java.lang.String song_title,
                                                              java.lang.String artist_name,
                                                              boolean store_result)
Use the provided metadata to extract the Echo Nest Song ID from the Echo Nest API. Note that this is not done with reference to any audio samples that may be available locally (this fingerprinting methods of this class should be used if one wishes to identify a song based on its audio). This method is best used when fingerprinting is unavailable or is unsuccesful. Depending on the vaule of the store_results field, the Song ID may be stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field.

Note that since it is only possible to specify song title and artist name that there may be confusion as to the particular version of the song if there are multiple recordings available for the same artist.

Parameters:
song_title - The title of the song. This may not be null.
artist_name - The "artist" of the song (typically refers to performer/band, although it is sometimes used to refer to composer, especially for classical music). This may be null if this information is unknown.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the Echo Nest Song ID to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
Returns:
The Echo Nest Song ID of the song that the Echo Nest API matches to the specified metadata. Null if there are no matches.

getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDUsingBestAvailableMethod

public java.lang.String getAndStoreEchoNestSongIDUsingBestAvailableMethod(java.lang.String music_file_path,
                                                                          java.lang.String song_title,
                                                                          java.lang.String artist_name,
                                                                          boolean store_results,
                                                                          java.io.PrintStream report_failures_stream,
                                                                          java.lang.String run_script_path,
                                                                          java.lang.String en_codegen_directory)
Attempts to identify a song by finding its Echo Nest Song ID using the Echo Nest API. Three techniques are succesfively applied unitl one is succesful. The first is local fingerprinting, the second is remote fingerprinting and the third is embedded metadata-based identification.

This method returns the Song ID as soon as one of these techniques is successful, and does not continue on to try other techniques unless the prior approaches did not work. The calling object may elect not to attempt certain approaches by passing null to certain parameters, as described below.

Depending on the vaule of the store_results field, the Song ID may be stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field.

Parameters:
music_file_path - The path of the audio file to identify. Neither local nor remote fingerprinting will be performed if this is null.
song_title - The title of the song. Identification based on embedded metadata will not be performed if this is null.
artist_name - The "artist" of the song (typically refers to performer/band, although it is sometimes used to refer to composer, especially for classical music). This may be null if this information is unknown.
store_results - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding the Echo Nest Song ID to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
report_failures_stream - Where to report failures or errors that occur. Nothing is reported if this is null.
run_script_path - The path of the executable or script used to run the Echo Nest codegen. Local fingerprinting will not be attempted if this is null. e.g. "./ENFP_Codegen.sh"
en_codegen_directory - The path of the directory holding the Echo Nest codegen fingerprinting binary. Local fingerprinting will not be attempted if this is null. e.g. "/home/ENMF/"
Returns:
The Echo Nest Song ID of the song that the Echo Nest API matches to the specified music. Null if there are no matches.

getAndStoreSongMetaData

public MusicMetaData[] getAndStoreSongMetaData(java.lang.String song_id,
                                               boolean store_result,
                                               boolean store_fails)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
Extract all available metadata for the song with the specified Echo Nest Song ID from the Echo Nest API. Depending on the vaule of the store_results field, these metadata results may be stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field.

Parameters:
song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID of the song to extract metadata for.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding each piece of extracted metadata to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Echo Nest API an indication is added to the returned (and, if appropriate, stored) MusicMetaData highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored.
Returns:
An array holding references to all of the extracted song metadata for the specified song. Null is returned if no data could be found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown only if invalid song identification information is provided. An exception is not thrown if a given piece of metadata cannot be extracted for a valid song.

getAndStoreArtistMetaData

public MusicMetaData[] getAndStoreArtistMetaData(java.lang.String song_id,
                                                 boolean store_result,
                                                 boolean store_fails)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
Extract all available metadata for the artist associated with the song with the specified Echo Nest Song ID from the Echo Nest API (other than artist name and Echo Nest ID, which are extracted by the getAndStoreSongMetaData method). Depending on the vaule of the store_results field, these metadata results may be stored internally in this object's music_meta_data field.

Parameters:
song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID of the song to extract metadata for.
store_result - Whether or not to add a MusicMetaData object holding each piece of extracted metadata to the internal music_metadata Vector field (assuming succesful extraction).
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Echo Nest API an indication is added to the returned (and, if appropriate, stored) MusicMetaData highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored.
Returns:
An array holding references to all of the extracted artist metadata for the specified song. Null is returned if no data could be found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown only if invalid song identification information is provided. An exception is not thrown if a given piece of metadata cannot be extracted for a valid song.

getAllAvailableNewMetaData

public boolean getAllAvailableNewMetaData(java.lang.String song_id,
                                          java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                          java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> artist_metadata,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> artists_already_extracted,
                                          boolean store_identification_metadata,
                                          boolean store_fails)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Extracts all available song and, if appropriate, artist metadata for the specified Echo Nest Song ID from the Echo Nest API. Adds the extracted metadata to the two Vector parameters of this method, respectively. Note that the extracted metadata is not stored in this object.

Song metadata is always extracted. Artist metadata is only extracted if it has not already been extracted for the given artist during the processing of another song, as indicated by the presence of the artist's name (in lower case) in the artists_already_extracted parameter. Note that this method does not update this hash map in any way, and it is left to the calling object to do this.

Parameters:
song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID of the song to extract metadata for.
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the artist associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artists_already_extracted - A hash map whose keys correspond to artist names (converted to lower case), and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding artist metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This parameter may be null, in which case it is ignored and artist extraction happens automatically. Also, the values may be null, in order to save space and processing for the calling object, but this has no effect on this method, as only the keys are used.
store_identification_metadata - Whether or not to store metadata previously extracted by this object (typically song identification data) to the song_metadata Vector.
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Echo Nest API an indication is added to the stored MusicMetaData highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored. Note that this parameter has no effect on song identification specifically.
Returns:
True is returned if a change was made to song_metadata, artist_metadata or both.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if invalid parameters are passed.

getIdentifyingMetadataForSong

public java.lang.String[] getIdentifyingMetadataForSong(java.lang.String song_id)
Return the song title and artist name for the specifried Echo Nest Song ID.

Parameters:
song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID of the song to extract metadata for.
Returns:
The song title and artist name (in that order) of the specified song. Null is returned if no song could be found for the specified song_id.

getEchoNestArtistID

public java.lang.String getEchoNestArtistID(java.lang.String artist_name)
Returns the Echo Nest Artist ID for the specified artist.

Parameters:
artist_name - The name of the artist to identify.
Returns:
The Echo Nest Artist ID, or null if it could not be found or a problem occured.

getArtistNameLowerCase

public java.lang.String getArtistNameLowerCase(java.lang.String song_id)
Get the artist name for the artist associated with the specified Echo Nest Song ID.

Parameters:
song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID of the song for which the artist name is being queried.
Returns:
The name of the artist, or null if it could not be found or a problem occured. Note that the artist's name is converted to lower case in the returned string.

getMusicBrainzArtistID

public java.lang.String getMusicBrainzArtistID(java.lang.String song_id)
Get the Music Brainz Artist ID for the artist associated with the specified Echo Nest Song ID.

Parameters:
song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID of the song for which the Music Brainz Aritt ID is being queried.
Returns:
The Music Brainz Artist ID, or null if it could not be found or a problem occured. Note that the prefix of "musicbrainz:artist:" added by the Echo Nest is stripped away.
